values:
writer's block: gift-giving

This is a double-edged sword... There is pleasure in seeing a loved one's face light up at an unexpectedly perfect gift, a feeling which can be addictive in that moment's fleeting and elusive quality. But a fake smile, ones that doesn't crinkle their eyes or make them glow from within can be just as stingy or disappointing as when you get a thoughtless or generic gift yourself.
The price of a gift is worthless information. It is the feeling and thought behind it that makes it rich.
So, is gift-giving pleasurable or onerous? I think... you should give a gift because you want to, not because you have to because it is a gesture that can be just as telling of the giver as it is the receiver.

"fun"
the evidence of a joyful night,
where the clash your of teeth echoes in your ears,
and where the silent marching thumps against your eardrums.
all is static; all is noise.
an endless loop of feedback that dulls all other sounds,
overriding normal, overwhelming boredom...
the sound of "fun".

(source:unknown)

... soon....hopefully soon.

writer's block: dynamite with a laserbeam

Motion City Soundtrack's "Commit this to Memory" (oh the irony) and "I Am the Movie" albums.
It makes me yearn for conversations passed on sheets of paper doodled on within an inch of their lives, pictures revealed under red hued light, and the recklessness of ditching for a day at the beach.
It isn't until after you leave that you recognize the predictable ease of high school, the set schedules, the reliable friendships, the rigid finish-line of graduation. It is the "then what?" that follows, the same question that will repeat like a broken record for the rest of your life, which the real challenge begins. Because, it is now up to you to chooses your schedules, your friendships, your finish-line.
...

And although this album brings nostalgia, it also brings courage and hopes and ambitions that can never be bigger than when seen through the eyes of an 18 year-old ready to shed the comfort a 4 year routine and take on the world. So put it on track 3, and get you s*** together.
(source:unknown)

"Pirates" is a network whore.

Poem: "Where Truth Lies" Maps, once made, leave the impression of a place gone dead. Words, once said, anchor the fevers in the head. Vows, once taken, fade in the shadows of a place foresaken. Oh, understand how the mind's landscape forms from shifting sand, how where we are is partly solid ground, part head-in-air, a twilit zone where changing flesh and changeless ghost are one, and what is true lies between you and the idea of you -- a friction, restless, between the fact and the fiction.
- Alastair Reid

Movie: Inception Quote:
"You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling."
- Eames (Tom Hardy)
...
Beautiful. Brilliant. And all the other single word sound bites that could describe such a mind-blowing film. With haunting music that echoes in your head long after the screen cuts to black and more twists than a city literally folding itself like a paper crane, this movie is a prime example of what real ambitious imagination can accomplish. No gimmicks of third dimensions needed, instead of reaching out to you, it pulls you in and holds you there until your mind spins as fast as the main character's silver top. It made my fingers twitch with the urge to pick up a pencil and attack the nearest blank surface; with words or pictures, I don't know. My mind was so packed full of ideas and images I that stumble so much as walk out of the theater like I had just taken a hit of something spectacular. Pure imagination, pure creation --- what a fearsome and awe-inspiring idea to behold.
...
But as the credits rolled and everything clicks into place, I wondered... if you had already lived a lifetime, your lifetime, would you choose to live through it again? would you really want to start from the beginning?

TV Show: Covert Affairs Quote:
"Was that a Sigh? Sounded like a sigh, like a troubled, guilty sigh."
- Auggie Anderson (Christopher Gorham)
...
Recently hooked. Reason to continue watching? Auggie Anderson. Or better yet, the UST between him and the lead character, Annie Walker. With their forces combined (figuratively), they could make any fangirl squee so hard she'll loose her voice and/or pass out from lack of oxygen. It's adorable; it's fluffy; and god help me, but I crave it like it's a diabetic craves chocolate. Let's hope this isn't going to be a CIA version of a "Bones-Booth-just-freakin'-suck-face-already... and like you mean it!" kind of relationship. UST is fun and a tad naughty, but 5+ seasons of it is just cruel, diabolically cruel. So keep your freeze rays to yourself. P.S. have you figured out what UST means yet?

Quotes:
"My imagination had more recently become better than cable."
- Anon.

(source:The Rain by `kkart)
...
Took a nap today and woke up to a T-storm warning and/or tornado watch. It was the wind that woke me up. The trees looked like they were doing yoga, bent sideways, 80 mph winds they said. They also said the get to the lowest point of your house just in case. I live in an apt building and no I'm not on the bottom floor. Yea that warning was very helpful. Luckily, we only got the thunderstorm part of the whole shebang, strong winds and all, but no cyclones. Still, I am thoroughly freaked out about what I might wake up to the next time I might nap. Alien abduction? Quite possible.

Currently watching the Science Channel and a show about singularities and the universe. I think its a good time as any to explain my take on the saying
"I drink the universe in a cup of rain."
It quite literally is true. Everything, from the rain that falls on the roof of your house to the skin  and muscle that wraps your bones is made up of the same atoms present during the big bang. The universe does not waste and, in that, you are timeless and eternal. Everything really is connected if you only look close enough.
...
You are also timeless in the sense that light has a limit in which how fast it can travel. It takes 8 minutes for the light of the sun to reach our planet. Therefore, if the sun were to disappear, we wouldn't know until 8 minutes after it happened, when blackness suddenly envelopes us whole. The exact image of you now will take millions of years to reach another star and still billions to reach another galaxy. When you look up into the night sky, you are perpetually seeing into the past. The stars you see now are how they looked millions if not billions of years ago (if they are far enough). We, in theory, should be able to see the beginning of time; the closest we've seen come in the form of quasars (primordial "stars" whose make-up still baffle scientists). So if you really want to see the dinosaurs in real life and not a Hollywood knock-off, you just need to be far enough away from the Earth to catch those old wavelengths of light.
...
Is your brain hurting yet? Do questions of time-travel manifest in your head after reading this? Will you look at the sun with suspicion and worry if it's still really there, or if it is just a massive mirage that will blink out of existence within the next eight minutes?
The universe is profound, every inch of it. Be thankful I'm not showing you a picture of the size of the sun compared to the our neighboring stars; the earth doesn't even constitute a pixel. If you truly want a lesson in humility, forget studying religion, just take an astronomy course.
Only then will you understand the span and depth of God's power; his creation.

(source: unknown)

Poem: "The Waste Land"

And I will show you something different from either
Your shadow at the morning striding behind you
Or you shadow at evening rising to meet you;
I will show you fear in a handful of dust.
- T.S. Elliot

Movie: Sense and Sensibility Quote:
"To love is to burn, to be like fire."
- Marianne
...
Watched the movie version today. People had so much time back then, so little distractions. They were able to really focus and put their all into the things which they did pay attention. I wonder if that's why all the great romances were written from that time, or that their grand gestures seem so over the top that they don't have a place in today's world. Distractions characterizes our time as much as the internet, television, or cellphones. I do believe there is a point were your are too connected to too many things. You begin to forget what's important.

stumbled a little more today, the internet is endless in both its depth and range of information. i love to learn, especially if it's about stuff a little off the beaten path. thought i'd share some new findings...
[side note:] the reason why i choose this color was because it's the color for the month i was born in. added my two cents beside the stuff that "matches," it's a little eerie how much of it does.
The meaning of the color "purple"... Power, success, idealism [goes without saying], psychic manifestations; ideal for rituals to secure ambitions, independence, financial rewards, or to make contact with the spiritual other world; increases Neptune energy. Magickal Purpose: Justice, royalty, the psychic, meditation, idealism, mysticism, guidance, divination. Personality: Proud, independent [sometimes painfully so], mystical arts, religious nature. This Person will not turn a blind eye, if they feel a cause of action is wrong, no matter the side they take [yes, this has reared its unattractive head at the worst possible moments and has gotten me into a fair amount of trouble at times]. Magickal Uses: Protection, justice power, spirit contact, breaking of bad luck, drive away evil, divination, spiritual and psychic powers [um, that seems a little extreme, but i do have a bad habit of deja vu and street lights to shut off when i'm around... like they have grudge against me or something, jk :) but it did freak the hell out of my friend once, was talking to her about it right as we walked under a street light... which shut off... and resulted in her manhandling me into sprinting the rest of the way to the car and i laughed the whole drive home.], Astral Projection [don't think so, i do have very very vivid dreams. sometimes i think i've already live through a day or already spoke to someone about something and find that i never did... which is really annoying at times]. This color is good to use when you don't have a white candle. ELEMENT: Air DIRECTION: East [i am partially made up of eastern origins] PLANET: Jupiter DAY: Thursday NUMBER: 7 SCENT/OIL: Cedar [i am obbessed with this smell, and it's a b**** to find it in a candle without it being tainted by vanilla or some other, clearly unwanted scent... i'm very peculiar about the sweet smells i like], Carnation, Nutmeg Lotus, Angelica, Bay, Cinnamon, Ginger, Sandalwood [this too! but not as good as cedar], Jasmine. PLANT/HERB: Mimosa, Wisteria, Mugwort Hazel, Eyebright, Rowan, Elder, Rue, Shamrock, Clover, Oak, Dandelion, Betony, Meadowsweet, Begonia, Cactus, Dahlia, Iris, Violet. WOOD: Willow [my favorite tree, they had them on base by my home. i always thought that they were elegant], Lilac, and Mulberry. ANIMAL: Elephant, Unicorn [thought i saw one where i was younger, with all my dearly missed childhood innocence and naivety... it was in Texas of all places... i was also in love with that Last Unicorn movie... gotta love the trippiness of old kiddy movies, sadly they don't make em like that anymore], Rabbit, Jaguar, Chickadee, Cuckoo, Eagle, Elk, Penguin [sweet jesus! it's the odd yet endearing nickname from my BF for years], Vulture [fine be that way], Grasshopper, Chameleon, Lizard [frank!]. FEATHER: Spirituality, religion STONES: Amethyst [birth stone!], Sapphire [love<3], Lapis Lazuli and Beryl, Clear Quartz, All Opals [my grandmother's birth stone, so pretty]. TAROT: Justice, Fours. GOD: Anase, Apollo, Forseti, Ida-ten, Mishara, Mithras, Musku, Tyr, Varuna GODDESS: Aleitheia, Astraea, Athene, Hecate, Justita, Kali, Maiat, Mens, Morrigan, Syn
(source: saucy)

And worse, the cable itself is out. Why me? Really. [EDIT: 10:30am... the next day] Internet's back on. I waited an hour last night to see if it would cut on, but no dice. of course it's just that evil.
Curiosity comes with teeth and sharp edges. It should be handled with care.

What if outer beauty was proportionate to beauty within?
...
Like an hourglass filled with sand. Beautiful insides meaning the lack of aesthetics on the out, that you could only be one way or the other. Why is it that beautiful people are stereotyped as being cruel, arrogant, or manipulating? Like their beauty is the telling that shows they've sold their soul to the devil. Is good will rewarded with disfigurement or is it the journey to a righteous soul that leaves one so drained. The savior in a fire, a hard-worker who supports his family in spite of his health. But maybe it is that beauty is a burden itself on its bearer. That the stereotype eats away at the beauty within until nothing is more important than their outward appearance. Maybe it is the ones that don't realize their outward beauty that are the ones who can escape the hourglass paradox, since when you are blind, everything is beautiful.

"Snooze".
...
Such an awkward word, and yet it can be found somewhere on nearly every alarm clock made. My cell phone alarm just rang (don't ask why) and asked me if I wanted to "snooze" ten more minutes or dismiss the alarm. Yes, yes i want to "snooze".... and no, i could not say that with a straight face. I guess "sleep in" was too wordy to be fit on an inch long button. And so, everyone will continue to be snoozers, and snooze those extra five or ten minutes as their brains try shoo the dreams away... Seriously, shouldn't there be some kind of borrowed foreign word for this? Like kamikaze or something...
(source: unknown)

My computer just updated and now my internet program refuses to work. My internet is working, just not the program to use it. It's like dangling chocolate in front of a fat kid and placing it just far enough way were he can't reach it (no offense...i'd be pissed too and i weigh the same as two big bags of flour). I really don't see what's wrong and it's starting to drive me way crazy. I need my internet to apply for jobs. FML.
...
[EDIT]: It's fixed now and, yes, it was the shitty windows update that did it (in the ballroom with a candle stick). Damn planned obsolescence and whoever was greedy enough to think up something that inherently evil. Why can't all technology be like those old Kitchaids. They could survive nuclear fallout for Christ's sake, fat chance that Vista could do that. Apparently not all things get smarter as they get older...

(source: unknown)

The present becomes so heavy, it verges to collapse into a black hole; dragging past and, more importantly,future into its singularity; shredding the very fabric of time, bending and distorting it like a wormhole until it faces itself again. an endless loop of present, reminding you that the only solution is waiting and ironically, time; even though time is now restricted to the present tense until something changes.
... the battle continues tomorrow.
I want a time machine...technology doesn't progress fast enough.
